name: RiskType
title: Risk Type
description: Risk Type codes for insurance operations.

concept.definition: A recreational trailer that does not fit into standard categories such as camping trailers or motorhomes.
A motorized off-road vehicle designed to handle a wider variety of terrain than most other vehicles.
A vehicle capable of operating on both land and water.
A standard single-family dwelling used as a primary residence.
A self-contained portable unit designed to be mounted on a truck bed for camping.
A towable trailer equipped for camping, which may include sleeping and cooking facilities.
A standard trailer without specialized features.
A privately owned residential unit within a multi-unit building or complex.
A building divided into two separate dwelling units.
A property owned and occupied by the policyholder as their primary residence.
A manufactured home that can be transported and is designed for permanent or semi-permanent residential use.
A low-powered motorized bicycle with pedals and a small engine.
A watercraft powered by an internal or external motor.
A two-wheeled motorized vehicle designed for road use.
A self-propelled recreational vehicle containing living quarters.
A small motorcycle with a step-through frame and a platform for the rider's feet.
A detachable motor mounted externally on the transom of a boat.
A small motorized watercraft designed to be operated by a person sitting, standing, or kneeling on it.
A personal automobile used primarily for non-commercial transportation of passengers.
A watercraft propelled primarily by sails.
A dwelling used as a secondary residence or occupied only during certain seasons.
A motorized vehicle designed for travel over snow, such as a snowmobile.
A dwelling occupied by tenants under a rental agreement.
A three-wheeled motorized vehicle configured as a motorcycle.
A building divided into three separate dwelling units.
A trailer designed for general-purpose hauling and transport.
A structure with a roof and walls designed for permanent use.
Machinery, tools, and other apparatus used in operations.
Inventory of goods held for sale or raw materials used in production.
Glass fixtures, windows, and other transparent or translucent surfaces.
Exterior or interior signage used for business identification or advertising.
Documents, records, and written materials that have value or are necessary for business operations.
Tools and equipment owned by contractors for construction or trade work.
Outstanding invoices and amounts owed by customers.
Furniture, supplies, and other personal property within an office environment.
Hand tools and power tools used in trades, maintenance, or construction.
Paintings, sculptures, and other artistic works of significant cultural or monetary value.
Electronic computing equipment and associated programs or applications.
Personal or business property while being transported from one location to another.
Commercial products and inventory being shipped or moved.
Industrial machines and mechanical equipment used in manufacturing or production.
Personal property and belongings located within a premises.
Real property consisting of the ground, soil, and earth.
A structure adjacent to or near the insured property.
Any vessel or craft designed for water navigation.
Any vehicle capable of atmospheric flight.
A facility or site where manufacturing or production activities occur.
Revenue generated from business operations that could be lost due to covered events.
The cessation or reduction of business operations due to covered perils.
All external glass surfaces of a building covered under a single item.
A structure under construction or renovation.
Materials, supplies, and equipment at a construction site.
A category used when the specific type does not fit predefined classifications.
Livestock, pets, or other animals not fitting specific categories.

concept.display: Audio Visual Data Media (CD, DVD, VHS, etc.)
concept.definition: Physical media used for storing audio, video, or data recordings.

designation.value: Médias audiovisuels de données (CD, DVD, VHS, etc.)
Medios de datos audiovisuales (CD, DVD, VHS, etc.)

concept.definition: Reference materials and publications used in professional practice.
Commercial signage for business identification or promotion.
Two-wheeled pedal-driven vehicles.
Short-distance radio communications system used by private citizens.
Photography equipment used for commercial or professional purposes.
Tents, sleeping bags, and other gear used for outdoor camping activities.
Fine porcelain dishware and dinnerware.
Responsibility for items temporarily stored in a checkroom or coat check facility.
Corrective lenses worn directly on the eye.
Personal photography equipment.
Collectible or rare currency pieces.
Trading cards or collectible cards of various types.
Mobile telephone device.
Tools and machinery used by contractors for construction or trade work.
A handheld or mobile cutting tool.
Items collected for their value, rarity, or personal interest.

designation.value: Objets de collection (Bandes dessinées, Épingles, Poupées, etc.)

concept.definition: Tools used in manufacturing to shape or form materials.
Items displayed at exhibitions, trade shows, or public presentations.
Coverage for equipment held by dealers for sale or demonstration.
Devices that operate using electronic circuits and components.
Paintings, sculptures, and other artistic works of cultural or monetary value.
Artistic works held for commercial purposes or by professional galleries.
Guns, rifles, and other weapons that discharge projectiles.
Rods, reels, tackle, and other gear used for fishing.
Machinery and tools used in logging and forest management.
Clothing and accessories made from animal pelts.

concept.display: Goods in Storage with Burglary (per day)
concept.definition: Stored goods with additional coverage for theft, rated on a daily basis.

designation.value: Biens entreposés avec vol qualifié (par jour)

concept.definition: A small motorized vehicle designed for transporting golfers and equipment on a golf course.
Clubs, bags, and other gear used for playing golf.
A device that converts mechanical energy into electrical energy.
Property owned but temporarily leased or rented out to third parties.
Items held in a warehouse or storage facility.
Electronic devices worn to amplify sound for individuals with hearing impairment.
Appliances used for freezing and storing food at home.
A lightweight two-wheeled cart pulled by a horse in harness racing.
A stone monument marking a burial site.
Bows, arrows, and other gear used for hunting or archery.

designation.value: Équipement de chasse et tir à l'arc

concept.definition: Personal ornaments such as rings, necklaces, and bracelets.
A portable personal computer.
Heavy machinery or substantial equipment used in industrial or commercial operations.
Power equipment used for lawn care, snow removal, or general utility tasks.

designation.value: Tondeuse à gazon/Souffleuse à neige/Tracteur utilitaire
Cortadora de césped/Soplador de nieve/Tractor utilitario

concept.definition: A transportable facility for producing asphalt for paving.
Devices and instruments used in healthcare and medical treatment.
Various items that do not fit into specific predefined categories.
Various sports gear not classified under specific sport categories.
Goods being transported by truck.
Instruments used by professional musicians or for commercial performances.
Devices used to create music for personal use.
Furniture, supplies, and equipment within an office space.
A wireless communication device that receives and displays numeric or text messages.
A desktop or home computer for individual use.
Corrective eyewear prescribed by an optometrist or ophthalmologist.
External drives, USB devices, and other media storage peripherals used with computers.

designation.value: Computadoras personales (Dispositivo de almacenamiento de medios)

concept.definition: Computer programs and applications installed on personal computers.
A scheduled policy covering specific personal items against various perils.
Coverage for personal belongings that may be moved or traveled with.
Medical instruments and devices used by doctors and surgeons.
Mobile radio communication devices and portable typing machines.

designation.value: Radios portatives et machines à écrire
Radios portátiles y máquinas de escribir

concept.definition: Racquets, balls, and gear for tennis, squash, badminton, and similar sports.
Devices for receiving radio and television broadcast signals.
Two-way communication devices capable of sending and receiving radio signals.

designation.value: Équipement de transmission et réception radio
Equipo de transmisión y recepción de radio

concept.definition: A board with an attached sail used for windsurfing.
Equipment for receiving satellite television or radio signals.
Diving gear including tanks, regulators, and masks for underwater breathing.
General athletic gear used for various sporting activities.
Precision tools and equipment used for scientific research and measurement.
Eating utensils and serving pieces made from silver or silver plate.
Skis, poles, boots, and other gear for downhill or cross-country skiing.
Collectible postage stamps.
Lighting, sound systems, props, and other gear used in theatrical productions.
Saddles, bridles, and other gear used for horseback riding.
Scheduled coverage for specific tools used professionally or commercially.
Luggage and personal belongings carried while traveling.
Automated machines that dispense products after payment is inserted.
An electric-powered wheelchair for mobility assistance.
Gifts received at a wedding ceremony.
Jewelry stored in a secure vault or safety deposit box.
Personal belongings not classified under specific categories.
Personal belongings covered regardless of geographic location.
Electronic devices for receiving broadcast television signals.
Hand and power tools used for personal or hobby purposes.
Cameras, recorders, and other devices for capturing and playing video.
Manual or non-motorized wheelchairs and other types not elsewhere classified.
MP3 players, portable CD players, and other mobile audio devices.
Reserve-quality wines held in a collection.
Vintage wines from specific years, often of high value.
A commercial or personal motor vehicle designed for hauling cargo.
A non-motorized vehicle designed to be towed by another vehicle.
A motor vehicle used for business or commercial purposes.
Agricultural land, buildings, and equipment used for farming operations.
Real estate owned for the purpose of generating rental income.
A building or land that is unoccupied and not in active use.
